revised_title: Molecular Grouping Influence on Organic Bodies' Infra-Red Absorption
tldr: The authors, Abney and Festing, investigate the influence of molecular grouping in organic bodies on their absorption in the infra-red region of the spectrum. They use an incandescent electric light source and various fluids to study the absorption spectra, concluding that each radical has a definite absorption in the infra-red and can be detected in a more complex body.
